questiontext.text: A researcher studies the effect of giving a lecture on scientific ethics to scientists. She also wants to know whether this effect differs between men and women. She asks a number of questions about this to 6 female and 6 male respondents at three times; before the lecture, shortly after the lecture and a few months after the lecture (3 measurements). She creates a scale from the responses for each measurement. What is the best method of analysis for her to use?

generalfeedback.text: This analysis is a combination of a Repeated Measures design (3 measurements per subject) and a between groups design (men vs.Â women). So, this is a Mixed Design ANOVA with one within and one between variable.

answer.text: Repeated measures ANOVA with two within variables
MANOVA with one within and one between variable
Mixed design ANOVA with two within and one between variable
Mixed design ANOVA with one within and one between variable
